TITLE: House GOP passes bill to curb Biden's use of oil reserve
SUMMARY: The bill is largely a messaging effort by Republicans.

TITLE: Republicans launch newest fight against Biden's oil drawdowns
SUMMARY: A bill to limit releases from the Strategic Petroleum Reserve seeks to blunt the political gains that Democrats have gained from lower gasoline prices.

TITLE: Big winners from Biden's climate law: Republicans who voted against it
SUMMARY: GOP lawmakers voted en masse against Biden’s signature bill. But roughly two-thirds of green-energy projects announced since it became law are going to Republican-held congressional districts, a POLITICO analysis found.

TITLE: 4 things to know about the gas stove frenzy
SUMMARY: The media storm surrounding gas stoves has shined a light on the environmental effects of the appliances and existing policies governing them. Here's what to know.

TITLE: What the right’s gas stove freakout was really about
SUMMARY: The Biden administration isn't proposing to outlaw the fossil-fuel-powered appliances. But they're at the center of a growing nationwide debate about city and state gas bans — and the latest Washington culture war.

TITLE: New study raises the heat on Exxon's secret climate research
SUMMARY: "ExxonMobil didn’t just know ‘something’ about global warming decades ago — they knew as much as academic and government scientists knew," researchers write in the journal Science. Still, the company "worked to deny it."

TITLE: Biden: North America should be ‘clean energy powerhouse of the world’
Meet the renewable energy source poised for growth with the help of the oil industry
SUMMARY: Companies already normally associated with oil and gas drilling in the United States have started delving more deeply into geothermal projects

TITLE: 'This makes my brain hurt': Connecticut used disaster aid to rebuild million-dollar homes
SUMMARY: Owners of 62 homes worth at least $1 million received recovery grants after Hurricane Sandy when HUD weakened rules meant to make needy people the priority, POLITICO’s E&E News found.

TITLE: Physical attacks on power grid surge to new peak
SUMMARY: People are shooting, sabotaging and vandalizing electrical equipment in the U.S. at a pace unseen in at least a decade, amid signs that domestic extremists hope to use blackouts to sow unrest.

TITLE: Biden administration set to start refilling oil reserve
SUMMARY: The Energy Department will start with an initial request for 3 million barrels, asking companies for the barrels to be delivered in February, an official said.

TITLE: U.S. touts fusion breakthrough as one of ‘most impressive scientific feats’ this century
SUMMARY: It will still take at least “a few decades" to turn the laboratory breakthrough into a viable source of energy for people and businesses, one Energy Department official said.

TITLE: What to know about DOE’s fusion milestone
SUMMARY: Experiments at a U.S. government lab may have provided "proof that the physics work." But future fusion reactors might turn to a different technology for replicating the energy that powers the sun.

TITLE: ‘It’s one of the biggest results of science in the past 20-30 years’
SUMMARY: But turning the newest breakthrough at a U.S. Energy Department lab into abundant, carbon-free power may require hundreds of billions of dollars. And many technical hurdles await.

TITLE: House Oversight Committee accuses oil companies of ‘lying’ about climate actions
SUMMARY: A spokesperson for Exxon blasted the committee’s release as cherry picking internal documents to cast the industry in a poor light.

TITLE: Biden enters a new type of tango with Paris
SUMMARY: The president is set to reaffirm America’s oldest alliance. But below the surface, repair work is needed.
